lines.value: <!the disorder is a chronic inflammatory condition in which the airways develop increased responsiveness to various stimuli characterized by bronchial hyper responsiveness inflammation increased mucus production and intermittent airway obstruction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the symptoms of asthma which can range from mild to life threatening can usually be controlled with a combination of drugs and lifestyle changes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: public attention in the developed world has recently focused on asthma because of its rapidly increasing prevalence affecting up to one in four urban children
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: susceptibility to asthma can be explained in part by genetic factors but no clear pattern of inheritance has been found
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: asthma is a complex disease that is influenced by multiple genetic developmental and environmental factors which interact to produce the overall condition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the word asthma is derived from the greek aazein meaning sharp breath the word first appears in homer's iliad hippocrates was the first to use it in reference to the medical condition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hippocrates thought that the spasms associated with asthma were more likely to occur in tailors anglers and metalworkers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: six centuries later galen wrote much about asthma noting that it was caused by partial or complete bronchial obstruction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: moses maimonides an influential medieval rabbi philosopher and physician wrote a treatise on asthma describing its prevention diagnosis and treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the 17th century bernardino ramazzini noted a connection between asthma and organic dust
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the use of bronchodilators started in 1901 but it was not until the 1960s that the inflammatory component of asthma was recognized and anti inflammatory medications were added to the regimen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an acute exacerbation of asthma is referred to colloquially as an asthma attack
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the clinical hallmarks of an attack are shortness of breath dyspnea and wheezing the latter often being regarded as the sine qua non a cough sometimes producing clear sputum may also be present
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the onset is often sudden there is a sense of constriction in the chest breathing becomes difficult and wheezing occurs primarily upon expiration but can be in both respiratory phases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: signs of an asthmatic episode are wheezing rapid breathing tachypnea prolonged expiration a rapid heart rate tachycardia rhonchous lung sounds audible through a stethoscope and over inflation of the chest
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during a serious asthma attack the accessory muscles of respiration sternocleidomastoid and scalene muscles of the neck may be used shown as in drawing of tissues between the ribs and above the sternum and clavicles and the presence of a paradoxical pulse a pulse that is weaker during inhalation and stronger during exhalation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during very severe attacks an asthma sufferer can turn blue from lack of oxygen and can experience chest pain or even loss of consciousness
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: severe asthma attacks may lead to respiratory arrest and death
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: despite the severity of symptoms during an asthmatic episode between attacks an asthmatic may show few signs of the disease
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in most cases a physician can diagnose asthma on the basis of typical findings in a patient's clinical history and examination
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: asthma is strongly suspected if a patient suffers from eczema or other allergic conditions suggesting a general atopic constitution or has a family history of asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while measurement of airway function is possible for adults most new cases are diagnosed in children who are unable to perform such tests
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: diagnosis in children is based on a careful compilation and analysis of the patient's medical history and subsequent improvement with an inhaled bronchodilator medication
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in adults diagnosis can be made with a peak flow meter which tests airway restriction looking at both the diurnal variation and any reversibility following inhaled bronchodilator medication
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: testing peak flow at rest or baseline and after exercise can be helpful especially in young asthmatics who may experience only exercise induced asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the diagnosis is in doubt a more formal lung function test may be conducted
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: once a diagnosis of asthma is made a patient can use peak flow meter testing to monitor the severity of the disease
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: before diagnosing someone as asthmatic alternative possibilities should be considered
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a physician taking a history should check whether the patient is using any known bronchoconstrictors substances that cause narrowing of the airways e.g certain anti inflammatory agents or beta blockers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease which closely resembles asthma is correlated with more exposure to cigarette smoke an older patient less symptom reversibility after bronchodilator administration as measured by spirometry and decreased likelihood of family history of atopy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: aspiration whether direct due to dysphagia swallowing disorder or indirect due to acid reflux can show similar symptoms to asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however with aspiration fevers might also indicate aspiration pneumonia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: direct aspiration dysphagia can be diagnosed by performing a modified barium swallow test and treated with feeding therapy by a qualified speech therapist
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the aspiration is indirect from acid reflux then treatment directed at this is indicated
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: only a minority of asthma sufferers have an identifiable allergy trigger
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the majority of these triggers can often be identified from the history for instance asthmatics with hay fever or pollen allergy will have seasonal symptoms those with allergies to pets may experience an abatement of symptoms when away from home and those with occupational asthma may improve during leave from work
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: occasionally allergy tests are warranted and if positive may help in identifying avoidable symptom triggers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after pulmonary function has been measured radiological tests such as a chest x ray or ct scan may be required to exclude the possibility of other lung diseases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in some people asthma may by triggered by gastroesophageal reflux disease which can be treated with suitable antacids
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: very occasionally specialized tests after inhalation of methacholine or even less commonly histamine - may be performed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: asthma is categorized by the nih heart lung and blood institute as falling into one of four categories mild intermittent mild persistent moderate persistent and severe persistent
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the diagnosis of severe persistent asthma occurs when symptoms are continual with frequent exacerbations and frequent nighttime symptoms result in limited physical activity and when lung function as measured by pev or fev1 tests is less than 60% predicted with pef variability greater than 30%
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in essence asthma is the result of an abnormal immune response in the bronchial airways
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the airways of asthmatics are hypersensitive to certain triggers also known as stimuli see below
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in response to exposure to these triggers the bronchi large airways contract into spasm an asthma attack
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: inflammation soon follows leading to a further narrowing of the airways and excessive mucus production which leads to coughing and other breathing difficulties
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are seven categories of stimuli
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mechanisms behind allergic asthma i.e asthma resulting from an immune response to inhaled allergens are the best understood of the causal factors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in both asthmatics and non asthmatics inhaled allergens that find their way to the inner airways are ingested by a type of cell known as antigen presenting cells or apcs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: apcs then present pieces of the allergen to other immune system cells
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in most people these other immune cells t h 0 cells check and usually ignore the allergen molecules
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in asthmatics however these cells transform into a different type of cell t h 2 for reasons that are not well understood
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the resultant t h 2 cells activate an important arm of the immune system known as the humoral immune system
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the humoral immune system produces antibodies against the inhaled allergen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: later when an asthmatic inhales the same allergen these antibodies recognize it and activate a humoral response
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: inflammation results chemicals are produced that cause the airways to constrict and release more mucus and the cell mediated arm of the immune system is activated
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the inflammatory response is responsible for the clinical manifestations of an asthma attack
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the following section describes this complex series of events in more detail
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when an inhaled antigen becomes trapped in the airways it is enzymatically degraded into shorter peptides by apcs such as dendritic cells
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: apcs express the peptides derived from the antigen on the cell surface in what is known as the binding groove of the class ii major histocompatiblity complex mhc molecule
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: now located on the cell surface the antigen mhc complex is presented to t cells which express a receptor that is specific to the mhc ii peptide
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: presented with the antigen mhc ii complex t helper 0 t h 0 cells become activated and start to differentiate into either t helper type 1 t h 1 or type 2 t h 2 cells
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the selective differentiation of t h 0 cells has profound consequences for the immune system t h 1 cell production leads to cell mediated immunity while the production of predominantly t h 2 cells provides humoral immunity
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the resulting balance of t h 1 or t h 2 cells is a crucial variable in the development of asthma the dominance of the t h 2 cell type appears to be necessary for the development of asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in one study mice that lacked the ability to create t h 1 cells displayed an asthma like phenotype
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the variables that decide the fate of t h 1 vs t h 2 cells are not well understood but depend on many factors including childhood exposure to infectious agents and the cytokines elicited by those agents
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one cytokine secreted by t h 2 cells il 4 combined with the action of other cytokines induces synthesis by antigen stimulated b cells of ige an allergen specific antibody
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ige binds allergens and then receptors on mast cells basophils and eosinophils in the airway epithelium
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: subsequent exposure of the same antigen to these cells in the airway epithelium initiates the acute phase reaction of asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: stimulated mast cells in the airway release preformed granules of mediators such as histamine eicosanoids and cytokines
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these molecules are responsible for the symptoms of asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they affect the mucosa of the airways increasing mucosal oedema and mucus production smooth muscle constriction and recruit other immune cells thereby exacerbating the reaction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the late phase of an asthmatic reaction is characterized by an influx of inflammatory and immune cells during the first several hours after antigen exposure
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these cells particularly eosinophils secrete a series of cytokines leukotrienes and polypeptides which contribute to hyperresponsiveness mucus secretion bronchoconstriction and sustained inflammation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the fundamental problem in asthma appears to be immunological young children in the early stages of asthma show signs of excessive inflammation in their airways
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: epidemiological findings give clues as to the pathogenesis the incidence of asthma seems to be increasing worldwide and asthma is now very much more common in affluent countries
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one theory of pathogenesis is that asthma is a disease of hygiene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in nature babies are exposed to bacteria and other antigens soon after birth switching on the t h 1 lymphocyte cells of the immune system that deal with bacterial infection
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if this stimulus is insufficient as it may be in modern clean environments then t h 2 cells predominate and asthma and other allergic diseases may develop
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this hygiene hypothesis may explain the increase in asthma in affluent populations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the t h 2 lymphocytes and eosinophil cells that protect us against parasites and other infectious agents are the same cells responsible for the allergic reaction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the developed world these parasites are now rarely encountered but the immune response remains and is wrongly triggered in some individuals by certain allergens
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: another theory is based on the correlation of air pollution and the incidence of asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although it is well known that substantial exposures to certain industrial chemicals can cause acute asthmatic episodes it has not been proved that air pollution is responsible for the development of asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in western europe most atmospheric pollutants have fallen significantly over the last 40 years while the prevalence of asthma has risen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: finally it has been postulated that some forms of asthma may be related to infection in particular by chlamydia pneumoniae
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this issue remains controversial as the relationship is not borne out by meta analysis of the research
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the correlation seems to be not with the onset but rather with accelerated loss of lung function in adults with new onset of non atopic asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one possible explanation is that some asthmatics may have altered immune response that facilitates long term chlamydia pneumonia infection
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: .the response to targeting with macrolide antibiotics has been investigated but the temporary benefit reported in some studies may reflect just their anti inflammatory activities rather than their antimicrobic action
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most effective treatment for asthma is identifying triggers such as pets or aspirin and limiting or eliminating exposure to them
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: desensitization is commonly attempted but has not been shown to be effective
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as is common with respiratory disease smoking adversely affects asthmatics in several ways including an increased severity of symptoms a more rapid decline of lung function and decreased response to preventive medications
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: asthmatics who smoke typically require additional medications to help control their disease
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furthermore exposure of both nonsmokers and smokers to secondhand smoke is detrimental resulting in more severe asthma more emergency room visits and more asthma related hospital admissions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: smoking cessation and avoidance of those who smoke is strongly encouraged in asthmatics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the specific medical treatment recommended to patients with asthma depends on the severity of their illness and the frequency of their symptoms
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: specific treatments for asthma are broadly classified as relievers preventers and emergency treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the expert panel report 2 guidelines for the diagnosis and management of asthma epr-2 of the us national asthma education and prevention program and the british guideline on the management of asthma are broadly used and supported by many doctors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bronchodilators are recommended for short term relief in all patients
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for those who experience occasional attacks no other medication is needed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for those with mild persistent disease more than two attacks a week low dose inhaled glucocorticoids or alternatively an oral leukotriene modifier a mast cell stabilizer or theophylline may be administered
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for those who suffer daily attacks a higher dose of glucocorticoid in conjunction with a long acting inhaled b-2 agonist may be prescribed alternatively a leukotriene modifier or theophylline may substitute for the b-2 agonist
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in severe asthmatics oral glucocorticoids may be added to these treatments during severe attacks
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for those in whom exercise can trigger an asthma attack exercise-induced asthma higher levels of ventilation and cold dry air tend to exacerbate attacks
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for this reason activities in which a patient breathes large amounts of cold air such as cross country skiing tend to be worse for asthmatics whereas swimming in an indoor heated pool with warm humid air is less likely to provoke a response
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: symptomatic control of episodes of wheezing and shortness of breath is generally achieved with fast acting bronchodilators
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these are typically provided in pocket sized metered dose inhalers mdis-see the image to the right
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in young sufferers who may have difficulty with the coordination necessary to use inhalers or those with a poor ability to hold their breath for 10 seconds after inhaler use generally the elderly an asthma spacer see top image is used
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the spacer is a plastic cylinder that mixes the medication with air in a simple tube making it easier for patients to receive a full dose of the drug and allows for the active agent to be dispersed into smaller more fully inhaled bits
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a nebulizer which provides a larger continuous dose can also be used
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nebulizers work by vaporizing a dose of medication in a saline solution into a steady stream of foggy vapour which the patient inhales continuously until the full dosage is administered
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is no clear evidence however that they are more effective than inhalers used with a spacer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nebulizers may be helpful to some patients experiencing a severe attack
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: such patients may not be able to inhale deeply so regular inhalers may not deliver medication deeply into the lungs even on repeated attempts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since a nebulizer delivers the medication continuously it is thought that the first few inhalations may relax the airways enough to allow the following inhalations to draw in more medication
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: relievers include
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: current treatment protocols recommend prevention medications such as an inhaled corticosteroid which helps to suppress inflammation and reduces the swelling of the lining of the airways in anyone who has frequent greater than twice a week need of relievers or who has severe symptoms
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if symptoms persist additional preventive drugs are added until the asthma is controlled
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: with the proper use of prevention drugs asthmatics can avoid the complications that result from overuse of relief medications
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: asthmatics sometimes stop taking their preventive medication when they feel fine and have no problems breathing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this often results in further attacks and no long term improvement
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: preventive agents include the following
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: long acting bronchodilators labd give a 12-hour effect and are used to give a smoothed symptomatic effect used morning and night
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while patients report improved symptom control these drugs do not replace the need for routine preventers and their slow onset means the short acting dilators may still be required
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in november of 2005 the american fda released a health advisory alerting the public to findings that show the use of long acting b 2 agonists could lead to a worsening of symptoms and in some cases death currently available long acting beta 2 adrenoceptor agonists include salmeterol formoterol bambuterol and sustained release oral albuterol
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: combinations of inhaled steroids and long acting bronchodilators are becoming more widespread the most common combination currently in use is fluticasone salmeterol advair in the united states and seretide in the uk
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when an asthma attack is unresponsive to a patient's usual medication other treatments are available to the physician or hospital
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many asthmatics like those who suffer from other chronic disorders use alternative treatments surveys show that roughly 50% of asthma patients use some form of unconventional therapy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: , there are little data to support the effectiveness of most of these therapies
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a cochrane systematic review of acupuncture for asthma found no evidence of efficacy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a similar review of air ionizers found no evidence that they improve asthma symptoms or benefit lung function this applied equally to positive and negative ion generators
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a study of manual therapies for asthma including osteopathic chiropractic physiotherapeutic and respiratory therapeutic maneuvers found no evidence to support their use in treating asthma these manoeuvres include various osteopathic and chiropractic techniques to increase movement in the rib cage and the spine to try and improve the working of the lungs and circulation chest tapping shaking vibration and the use of postures to help shift and cough up phlegm on the other hand one meta analysis found that homeopathy has a potentially mild benefit in reducing symptom intensity however the number of patients involved in the analysis was small and subsequent studies have not supported this finding
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: several small trials have suggested some benefit from various yoga practices ranging from integrated yoga programs -"yogasanas pranayama meditation and kriyas to sahaja yoga a form of meditation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a randomized controlled trial of just 39 patients suggested that the buteyko method may moderately reduce the need for beta agonists among asthmatics but found no objective improvement in lung function
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see also complementary and alternative medicine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the prognosis for asthmatics is good especially for children with mild disease
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for asthmatics diagnosed during childhood 54% will no longer carry the diagnosis after a decade
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the extent of permanent lung damage in asthmatics is unclear
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: airway remodelling is observed but it is unknown whether these represent harmful or beneficial changes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although conclusions from studies are mixed most studies show that early treatment with glucocorticoids prevents or ameliorates decline in lung function as measured by several parameters
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for those who continue to suffer from mild symptoms corticosteroids can help most to live their lives with few disabilities
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mortality rate for asthma is low with around 6000 deaths per year in a population of some 10 million patients in the united states
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: better control of the condition may help prevent some of these deaths
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: asthma is usually diagnosed in childhood
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the risk factors for asthma include
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the incidence of asthma is higher among low income populations which in the western world are disproportionately minority and more likely to live near industrial areas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: additionally asthma has been strongly associated with the presence of cockroaches in living quarters which is more likely in such neighbourhoods
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the quality of asthma treatment varies along racial lines likely because many low income people cannot afford health insurance and because there is still a correlation between class and race
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example black americans are less likely to receive outpatient treatment for asthma despite having a higher prevalence of the disease
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they are much more likely to have emergency room visits or hospitalization for asthma and are three times as likely to die from an asthma attack compared to whites
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the prevalence of severe persistent asthma is also greater in low income communities compared with communities with better access to treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: asthma appears to be more prevalent in athletes than in the general population
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one survey of participants in the 1996 summer olympic games showed that 15% had been diagnosed with asthma and that 10% were on asthma medication
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these statistics have been questioned on at least two bases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: persons with mild asthma may be more likely to be diagnosed with the condition than others because even subtle symptoms may interfere with their performance and lead to pursuit of a diagnosis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it has also been suggested that some professional athletes who do not suffer from asthma claim to do so in order to obtain special permits to use certain performance enhancing drugs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there appears to be a relatively high incidence of asthma in sports such as cycling mountain biking and long distance running and a relatively lower incidence in weightlifting and diving
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is unclear how much of these disparities are from the effects of training in the sport and from self selection of sports that may appear to minimize the triggering of asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: , in addition there exists a variant of asthma called exercise induced asthma that shares many features with allergic asthma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it may occur either independently or concurrent with the latter
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: exercise studies may be helpful in diagnosing and assessing this condition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: * asthma wikipedia edisi basa inggris 14 maret 2006
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the earliest known system of classifying forms of life comes from the greek philosopher aristotle who classified all living organisms known at that time as either a plant or an animal

lines.value: he further classified animals based on their means of transportation air land or water

lines.value: the exploration of parts of the new world next brought to hand descriptions and specimens of many novel forms of animal life

lines.value: in the latter part of the 16th century and the beginning of the 17th careful study of animals commenced which directed first to familiar kinds was gradually extended until it formed a sufficient body of knowledge to serve as an anatomical basis for classification
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: advances in using this knowledge to classify living beings bear a debt to the research of medical anatomists such as fabricius 1537-1619 petrus severinus 1580-1656 william harvey 1578-1657 and edward tyson 1649-1708

lines.value: successive developments in the history of insect classification may be followed on the website by clicking on succeeding works in chronological order

lines.value: since late in the 16th century a number of authors had become concerned with what they called methodus or method
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by method they meant an arrangement of minerals plants and animals according to the principles of logical division
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the term methodists was coined by carolus linnaeus in his bibliotheca botanica to denote the authors who care about the principles of classification in contrast to the mere collectors who are concerned primarily with the description of plants paying little or no attention to their arrangement into genera etc
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: important early methodists were an italian philosopher physician and botanist andrea caesalpino an english naturalist john ray a german physician and botanist augustus quirinus rivinus and a french physician botanist and traveller joseph pitton de tournefort
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: andrea caesalpino 1519-1603 in his de plantis libri xvi 1583 proposed the first methodical arrangement of plants
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on the basis of the structure of trunk and fructification he divided plants into fifteen higher genera
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: john ray 1627-1705 was an english naturalist who published important works on plants animals and natural theology
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the approach he took to the classification of plants in his historia plantarum was an important step towards modern taxonomy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ray rejected the system of dichotomous division by which species were classified according to a pre conceived either or type system and instead classified plants according to similarities and differences that emerged from observation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: both caesalpino and ray used traditional plant names and thus the name of a plant did not reflect its taxonomic position e.g even though the apple and the peach belonged to different higher genera of john ray's methodus both retained their traditional names malus and malus persica respectively
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a further step was taken by rivinus and pitton de tournefort who made genus a distinct rank within taxonomic hierarchy and introduced the practice of naming the plants according to their genera
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: augustus quirinus rivinus 1652-1723 in his classification of plants based on the characters of the flower introduced the cathegory of order corresponding to the higher genera of john ray and andrea caesalpino
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he was the first to abolish the ancient division of plants into herbs and trees and insisted that the true method of division should be based on the parts of the fructification alone
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: rivinus extensively used dichotomous keys to define both orders and genera
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: his method of naming plant species resembled that of joseph pitton de tournefort
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the names of all plants belonging to the same genus should begin with the same word generic name
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the genera containing more than one species the first species was named with generic name only while the second etc were named with a combination of the generic name and a modifier differentia specifica
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: joseph pitton de tournefort 1656-1708 introduced an even more sophisticated hierarchy of class section genus and species
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he was the first to use consistently the uniformly composed species names which consisted of a generic name and a many worded diagnostic phrase differentia specifica
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unlike rivinus he used differentiae with all species of polytipic genera
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: two years after john ray's death carolus linnaeus 1707-1778 was born
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: his great work the systema naturae ran through twelve editions during his lifetime 1st ed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in this work nature was divided into three kingdoms mineral vegetable and animal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: linnaeus used five ranks class order genus species and variety
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he abandoned long descriptive names of classes and orders and two word generic names e
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: g bursa pastoris still used by his immediate predecessors rivinus and pitton de tournefort and replaced them with single word names provided genera with detailed diagnoses characteres naturales and reduced numerous varieties to their species thus saving botany from the chaos of new forms produced by horticulturalists
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: linnaeus is best known for his introduction of the method still used to formulate the scientific name of every species
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: before linnaeus long many worded names composed of a generic name and a differentia specifica had been used but as these names gave a description of the species they were not fixed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in his philosophia botanica 1751 linnaeus took every effort to improve the composition and reduce the length of the many worded names by abolishing unnecessary rhetorics introducing new descriptive terms and defining their meaning with an unprecedented precision
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the late 1740s linnaeus began to use a parallel system of naming species with nomina trivialia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nomen triviale a trivial name was a single or two word epithet placed on the margin of the page next to the many worded scientific name
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the only rules linnaeus applied to them was that the trivial names should be short unique within a given genus and that they should not be changed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: linnaeus consistently applied nomina trivialia to the species of plants in species plantarum 1st edn
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: 1753 and to the species of animals in the 10th edition of systema naturae 1758
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by consistently using these specific epithets linnaeus separated nomenclature from taxonomy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: even though the parallel use of nomina trivialia and many worded descriptive names continued until late in the eighteenth century it was gradually replaced by the practice of using shorter proper names combined of the generic name and the trivial name of the species
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the nineteenth century this new practice was codified in the first rules and laws of nomenclature and the 1st edn
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: of species plantarum and the 10th edn
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: of systema naturae were chosen as starting points for the botanical and zoological nomenclature respectively
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this convention for naming species is referred to as binomial nomenclature
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: today nomenclature is regulated by nomenclature codes which allows names divided into ranks see rank botany and rank zoology
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: more generally the cumulants of a sequence { m n : n = 1 2 3 } not necessarily the moments of any probability distribution are given by where the values of &kappa n for n = 1 2 3 are found formally i.e by algebra alone in disregard of questions of whether any series converges

lines.value: dina matematik sarta dina sabagean statistik the pearson product moment correlation coefficient r is a measure of how well a linear equation describes the relation between two variables x and y measured on the same object or organism
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is defined as the sum of the products of the skor standard of the two measures divided by the degrees of freedom : = mean of y the correlation coefficient adds a sign to show the direction of the relationship
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the formula for the pearson coefficient conforms to this definition and applies when the relationship is linear
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the coefficient ranges from -1 to 1
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a value of 1 shows that a linear equation describes the relationship perfectly and positively with all data points lying on the same line and with y increasing with x a score of -1 shows that all data points lie on a single line but that y increases as x decreases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a value of 0 shows that a linear model is inappropriate &#8211 that there is no linear relationship between the variables
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the pearson coefficient is a statistic which estimates the correlation of the two given random variables
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the linear equation that best describes the relationship between x and y can be found by linear regression
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if x and y are both normally distributed this can be used to predict the value of one measurement from knowledge of the other
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: that is for each value of x the equation calculates a value which is the best estimate of the values of y corresponding the specific value of x we denote this predicted variable by y any value of y can therefore be defined as the sum of y and the difference between y and y the square of r is conventionally used as a measure of the strength of the association between x and y for example if the coefficient is .90 then 81% of the variance of y is said to be explained by the changes in x and the linear relation between x and y r is a statistik parametrik
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it assumes that the variables being assessed are normally distributed

lines.value: if this assumption is violated a non parametric alternative such as spearman's &rho may be more successful in detecting a linear relationship

lines.value: population dynamics is the study of marginal and long term changes in the numbers individual weights and age composition of individuals in one or several populations and biological and environmental processes influencing those changes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: population dynamics is the dominant branch of mathematical biology which has a history of more than 200 years
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the early period was dominated by demographic studies such as the work of benjamin gompertz 5 march1779-14 july1865 and pierre francois verhulst 28 october1804-15 february1849 who refined and adjusted the malthusian demograhical model
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a more general model formulation was proposed by fj richards in 1959 by which the models of gompertz verhulst and also ludwig von bertalanffy are covered as special cases of the general formulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the computer game simcity tries to simulate some of these population dynamics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: population dynamics also attempts to study topics such as aging populations or population decline
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see also system dynamics volterra lotka equations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the densities of the sums of two three and four terms were constructed as the convolution of the original density with itself
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as the original density is a piecewise polynomial of degree 0 and 1 the convolutions are also piecewise polynomials of increasing degree
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: thus the convolution of the original density may be considered a means of constructing a piecewise polynomial approximation to the normal density
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the convolutions were computed via the discrete fourier transform
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a list of values y = f(x 0 + k δx was constructed where f is the original density function and δx is approximately equal to 0.002 and k is equal to 0 through 1000
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the discrete fourier transform y of y was computed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: then the convolution of f with itself is proportional to the inverse discrete fourier transform of the pointwise product of y with itself
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the basic functional unit of the kidney is the nephron of which there are more than a million in each normal adult kidney
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nephrons regulate water and soluble substances especially electrolytes in the body by filtering it all out first reabsorbing what should be kept and converting the rest into urine for excretion
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they use countercurrent exchange mechanisms
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a nephron consists of an initial filtering component called the renal corpuscle or malpighian corpuscle and a renal tubule that extends from the renal corpuscle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: each renal corpuscle contains a compact bunch of interconnected capillaries called the glomerulus which protrudes into the bowman's capsule
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: each glomerulus is supplied with blood by an afferent in-coming arteriole
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: blood leaves the glomerulus through an efferent out-going arteriole
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the bowman's capsule contains a fluid filled space called bowman's space which is separated from blood in the glomerulus by three layers the renal tubule is continuous with bowman's capsule
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the segment that drains glomerular filtrate from the bowman's capsule is the proximal convoluted tubule
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the next portion of the tubule is the loop of henle which leads to the distal convoluted tubule
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the loop of henle was named after friedrich gustav jakob henle who described it in the early 1860s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the loop of henle maintains an osmotic gradient set up as a countercurrent exchange to filter and concentrate glomerular filtrate
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: fluid flows from the distal convoluted tubule into the collecting duct system which consists of fluids become more concentrated along the tubules and ducts to form urine which is then drained into the bladder via the ureter
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the capacitated spermatozoon and the oocyte meet and interact in the ampulla of the fallopian tube

lines.value: in mammals binding of the spermatozoon to the zona pellucida an extracellular layer surrounding the oocyte initiates the acrosome reaction

lines.value: this process releases the enzyme hyaluronidase which digests the matrix of hyaluronic acid in the vestments surrounding the oocyte

lines.value: fusion between the sperm and oocyte plasma membranes follows allowing the entry of the sperm nucleus mitochondria centriole and flagellum into the oocyte

lines.value: once this happens the female is said to be pregnant

lines.value: after being fertilized the ovary starts to swell and becomes a fruit

lines.value: with multi seeded fruits multiple grains of pollen are necessary for syngamy with each ovule

lines.value: the process is easy to visualize if one looks at corn silk which is the female flower of corn

lines.value: the space often had access to a qanat and often contained a system of windcatchers that could easily bring temperatures inside the space down to frigid levels in summer days
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the ice was then used to chill treats for royalty during hot summer days
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: <!ice also plays a role in winter recreation namely the sports of ice skating ice hockey ice fishing ice climbing and bobsledding and luge sled racing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sometimes structures are built out of large chunks of ice
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however they are mostly ornamental as in the case with ice castles and not practical for long term habitation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ice hotels exist on a seasonal basis in a few cold areas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ice can also be an obstacle for harbors near the poles being ice free is an important advantage ideally all year round
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: examples are murmansk russia petsamo russia formerly finland and vardo
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: harbors that are not ice free are opened up using icebreakers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ice forming on roads is a dangerous winter hazard
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: black ice is very difficult to see because it lacks the expected glossy surface
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: whenever there is freezing rain or snow that occurs at a temperature near the melting point it is common for ice to build up on the windows of automobiles which must be removed in order to safely drive a vehicle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ice scrapers are tools designed to break the ice free and clear the windows though removing the ice can be a long labor intensive and stressful process especially when a driver ends up running late for work as a result
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: far enough below the freezing point a thin layer of ice crystals can form on the inside surface of windows
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this usually happens when a vehicle has been left alone after being driven for a while but can happen while driving if the outside temperature is low enough
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: moisture from the driver's breath is the source of water for the crystals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is troublesome to remove this form of ice so people often open their windows slightly when the vehicle is parked in order to let the moisture dissipate and it is now common for cars to have rear window defrosters to combat the problem
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a similar problem can happen in homes which is why many colder regions require double pane windows to insulate the inner pane from the outer temperature some homeowners even opt for triple pane windows
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when the outdoor temperature stays below freezing for extended periods very thick layers of ice can form on lakes and other bodies of water although places with flowing water require much colder temperatures
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the ice can become thick enough to drive onto in automobiles and trucks even large semi trailers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: doing this safely requires a thickness of at least 30 centimeters one foot
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the human quest for excitement has even led to ice racing where drivers must go fast on lake ice while also controlling the skid of their vehicle this is similar in some ways to dirt track racing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the sport has even been modified to work on ice rinks
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tragically it is a regular occurrence for people to fall through thin ice and many die each year
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: inventors and safety organizations continue to find new devices and methods to help rescue people from icy waters and the shock that a body undergoes in such situations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the earliest examples of axes have heads of stone with some form of wooden handle attached hafted in a method to suit the available materials and use
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: axes made of copper bronze iron and steel appeared as these technologies developed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the axe is an example of a simple machine with the axe being a type of wedge
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this reduces the effort needed by the wood chopper
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most modern axes have steel heads and wooden handles typically hickory although plastic or fibreglass handles are not uncommon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: modern axes are specialized by use size and form
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hafted axes with short handles designed for use with one hand are often called hand axes but the term hand axe refers to axes without handles as well
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hatchets tend to be small hafted axes often with a hammer on the back side
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: early stone tools like the hand axe were probably not hafted
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first true hafted axes are known from the mesolithic period ca 6000 bc where axes made from antler were used that continued to be utilized in the neolithic in some areas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: chopping tools made from flint were hafted as adzes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: axes made from ground stone are known since the neolithic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they were used to fell trees and for woodworking
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: few wooden hafts have been found but it seems that the axe was normally hafted by wedging
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: birch tar and raw hide lashings were used to fix the blade
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since the late neolithic michelsberg culture cortaillod culture very small axe blades of a rectangular shape became common
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they were hafted with an antler sleeve
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this prevented both the splitting of the haft and softened the impact on the stone blade itself
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the earlier neolithic axe blades were made by first knapping and then grinding a stone
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by late neolithic times sawing wooden saws and sand became common
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this allowed a more efficient use of the raw material
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in scandinavia northern germany and poland axe blades made from knapped and polished flint were common
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: stone axes are quite efficient tools using one it takes about 10 minutes to fell a hardwood ash tree of 10 cm diameter one to two hours for an ash of 30 cm diameter
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: modern comparison 25 cm softwood white pine standing chop under two minutes with a 3.5 kg competition felling axe from the late neolithic onwards pfyn-altheim cultures flat axes were made of copper or copper mixed with arsenic

lines.value: bronze axes are found since the early bronze age a2

lines.value: the flat axe developed into palstaves flanged axes and later winged and socketed axes

lines.value: late neolithic axe factories where thousands of ground stone axes were roughed out are known from great britain for example great langdale in cumbria ireland lambay island porphyry rathlin island and tievebulliagh porcellanite poland krzemionki flint france plancher-les-mines vosges pelite plussulien brittany meta dolerite and italy val de'aoste omphacite

lines.value: at least since the late neolithic elaborate axes battle-axes t axes etc had a religious significance as well and probably indicated the exalted status of their owner

lines.value: in the roman fasces the axe symbolized the authority to decapitate

lines.value: in folklore stone axes were sometimes believed to be thunderbolts and were used to guard buildings against lightning as it was believed mythically that lightning never struck the same place twice

lines.value: an upright axe buried under the sill of a house would keep off witches while an axe under the bed would assure male offspring

lines.value: the axe is comprised of two primary components the axe head and the haft
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the axe head is typically bounded by the bit or blade at one end and the poll or butt at the other though some designs feature two bits opposite each other
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the top corner of the bit where the cutting edge begins is called the toe and the bottom corner is known as the heel
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: either side of the head is called the cheek which is sometimes supplemented by lugs where the head meets the haft and the hole where the haft is mounted is called the eye
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the part of the bit that descends below the rest of the axe head is called the beard and a bearded axe is an antiquated axe head with an exaggerated beard that can sometimes extend the cutting edge twice the height of the rest of the head the axe haft is sometimes called the handle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: traditionally it was made of a resilient hardwood like hickory or ash but modern axes often have hafts made of durable synthetic materials
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: antique axes and their modern reproductions like the tomahawk often had a simple straight haft with a circular cross section that wedged onto the axe head without the aid of wedges or pins
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: modern hafts are curved for better grip and to aid in the swinging motion and are mounted securely to the head the shoulder is where the head mounts onto the haft and this is either a long oval or rectangular cross section of the haft that's secured to the axe head with small metal or wooden wedges
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the belly of the haft is the longest part where it bows in gently and the throat is where it curves sharply down into to the short grip just before end of the haft which is known as the knob

lines.value: some species exhibit vestigial bones of the pelvis and rear legs which are externally apparent in the form of a pair of anal spurs on each side of the cloaca
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these spurs are larger in males than females and are used by the male to stimulate the female during copulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pythons are distinguishable from boas in that they have teeth on the premaxilla a small bone at the very front and center of the upper jaw
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some pythons display vivid patterns on their scales while others are a nondescript brown
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they usually reflect appropriate camouflage for their native habitat
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pythons are constrictors and feed on birds and mammals killing them by literally squeezing them to death
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they coil themselves up around their prey tighten but merely squeeze hard enough to stop the prey's breathing and or blood circulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: large pythons usually would eat something about the size of a house cat but larger food items are not unknown
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they swallow their prey whole and take several days or even weeks to fully digest it
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: despite their intimidating size and muscular power they are generally not dangerous to humans
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while a large adult python could kill a human being most likely by strangling rather than actual crushing humans are outside the normal size range for prey
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: reports of python attacks on humans are extremely rare
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: despite this pythons have been aggressively hunted driving some species like the indian python to the brink of extinction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most pythons have heat sensing organs in their lips
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these enable them to detect objects that are hotter than the surrounding environment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pythons that do not have heat sensing organs identify their prey by smell
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pythons are ambush predators they typically stay in a camouflaged position and then suddenly strike at passing prey
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they then grasp the prey in their teeth and kill by constriction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: death is usually a result of suffocation or heart failure rather than crushing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: females protecting their eggs can be aggressive.-->

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saperti wangun kahirupan sejenna dina biologi kahirupan tutuwuhan bisa ditalungtik tina jihat anu beda ti kalungguhan molekular genetik jeung biokimia ngaliwatan organel sel jaringan anggota badan individu populasi tutuwuhan jeung komunitas tutuwuhan
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dina masing masing kalungguhan ieu para ahli botani pakutet jeung papasingan klasifikasi taksonomi struktur anatomi atawa fungsi fisiologi kahirupan tutuwuhan
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: historically botany covers all organisms that were not considered to be animals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some of these plant like organisms include fungi studied in mycology bacteria and viruses studied in microbiology and algae studied in phycology
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most algae fungi and microbes are no longer considered to be in the plant kingdom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however attention is still given to them by botanists and bacteria fungi and algae are usually covered in introductory botany courses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the study of plants is important for a number of reasons
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: plants are a fundamental part of life on earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they generate the oxygen food fibres fuel and medicine that allow higher life forms to exist
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: plants also absorb carbon dioxide a significant greenhouse gas through photosynthesis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a good understanding of plants is crucial to the future of human societies as it allows us to
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: virtually all of the food we eat comes from plants either directly from staple foods and other fruit and vegetables or indirectly through livestock which rely on plants for fodder
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in other words plants are at the base of nearly all food chains or what ecologists call the first trophic level
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: understanding how plants produce the food we eat is therefore important to be able to feed the world and provide food security for future generations for example through plant breeding
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: not all plants are beneficial to humans some weeds are a considerable problem in agriculture and botany provides some of the basic science in order to understand how to minimise their impact
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however other weeds are pioneer plants which start an abused environment back on the road to rehabilitation underlining that the term weed is a very relative concept and that broadly defined a weed is simply a plant which is too successful
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ethnobotany is the study of this and other relationships between plants and people
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: plants are convenient organisms in which fundamental life processes like cell division and protein synthesis for example can be studied without the ethical dilemmas of studying animals or humans
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the genetic laws of inheritance were discovered in this way by gregor mendel who was studying the way pea shape is inherited
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: what mendel learnt from studying plants has had far reaching benefits outside of botany
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: additionally barbara mcclintock discovered jumping genes by studying maize
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these are a few examples that demonstrate how botanical research has an ongoing relevance to the understanding of fundamental biological processes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many of our medicinal and recreational drugs like cannabis caffeine and nicotine come directly from the plant kingdom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: aspirin which originally came from the bark of willow trees is just one example
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there may be many novel cures for diseases provided by plants waiting to be discovered
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: popular stimulants like coffee chocolate tobacco and tea also come from plants
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most alcoholic beverages come from fermenting plants such as barley malt and grapes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: plants also provide us with many natural materials such as cotton wood paper linen vegetable oils some types of rope and rubber
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the production of silk would not be possible without the cultivation of the mulberry plant
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sugarcane and other plants have recently been put to use as sources of biofuels which are important alternatives to fossil fuels
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: plants can also help us understand changes in on our environment in many ways
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: among the earliest of botanical works written around 300 bc are two large treatises by theophrastus on the history of plants historia plantarum and on the causes of plants
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: together these books constitute the most important contribution to botanical science during antiquity and on into the middle ages
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the roman medical writer dioscorides provides important evidence on greek and roman knowledge of medicinal plants
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1665 using an early microscope robert hooke discovered cells in cork a short time later in living plant tissue
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the german leonhart fuchs the swiss conrad von gesner and the british authors nicholas culpeper and john gerard published herbals that gave information on the medicinal uses of plants
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a considerable amount of new knowledge today is being generated from studying model plants like arabidopsis thaliana
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this mustard weed was one of the first plants to have its genome sequenced
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the sequencing of the rice genome and a large international research community have made rice the de facto cereal/grass/monocot model
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: another grass species brachypodium distachyon is also emerging as an experimental model for understanding the genetic cellular and molecular biology of temperate grasses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other commercially important staple foods like wheat maize barley rye millet and soybean are also having their genomes sequenced
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some of these are challenging to sequence because they have more than two haploid n sets of chromosomes a condition known as polyploidy common in the plant kingdom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the green yeast chlamydomonas reinhardtii a single celled green alga is another plant model organism that has been extensively studied and provided important insights into cell biology
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: * us geological survey
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: national biological information infrastructure botany
