lines.value: as part of a general movement toward formalism in mathematics in the nineteenth century attempts were made to put the integral calculus on a firm foundation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the riemann integral proposed by bernhard riemann 1826-1866 is a broadly successful attempt to provide such a foundation for the integral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: riemann's definition starts with the construction of a sequence of easily-calculated integrals which converge to the integral of a given function
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this definition is successful in the sense that it gives the expected answer for many already-solved problems and gives useful results for many other problems
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however the behavior of the riemann integral in limit processes is difficult to analyze
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is of prime importance for instance in the study of fourier series fourier transforms and other topics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the lebesgue integral is better able to describe how and when it is possible to take limits under the integral sign
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the lebesgue definition considers a different class of easily-calculated integrals than the riemann definition which is the main reason the lebesgue integral is better behaved
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the lebesgue definition also makes it possible to calculate integrals for a broader class of functions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example the function which is 0 where its argument is irrational and 1 otherwise has a lebesgue integral but it does not have a riemann integral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: we now give a highly technical description
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is possible to skip directly to the discussion heading for further technical and historical justification of the lebesgue integral if the reader is so inclined
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: let &mu be a non-negative measure on a sigma algebra x over a set e in real analysis e will typically be euclidean n space r n or some lebesgue measurable subset of it x will be the sigma algebra of all lebesgue measurable subsets of e and &mu will be the lebesgue measure
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in probability and statistics &mu will be a probability measure on a probability space e we build up an integral for real-valued functions defined on e as follows
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: fix a set s in x and let f be the function on e whose value is 0 outside of s and 1 inside of s i.e f(x = 1 if x is in s otherwise f(x = 0 this is called the indicator function or characteristic function of s and is denoted 1 s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: to assign a value to ∫1 s consistent with the given measure &mu the only reasonable choice is to set where the sum is finite and the coefficients a k are real numbers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: such a finite linear combination of indicating functions is called a simple function
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: note that a simple function can be written in many ways as a linear combination of characteristic functions but the integral will always be the same
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: now the difficulties begin as we attempt to take limits so that we can integrate more general functions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it turns out that the following process works and is most fruitful
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: let f be a non negative function supported on the set e we allow it to attain the value +&infin in other words f takes values in the extended real number line we define ∫f to be the supremum of ∫s where s varies over all simple functions which are under f that is s(x &le f(x for all x this is analogous to the lower sums of riemann
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however we will not build an upper sum and this fact is important in getting a more general class of integrable functions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one can be more explicit and mention the measure and domain of integration there is the question of whether this definition makes sense do simple function or indicating function keep the same integral there is also the question of whether this corresponds in any way to a riemann notion of integration
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is not so hard to prove that the answer to both questions is yes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: we have defined ∫f for any non negative function on e however for some functions ∫f will be infinite
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furthermore desirable additive and limit properties of the integral are not satisfied unless we require that all our functions are measurable meaning that the pre image of any interval is in x we will make this assumption from now on.to handle signed functions we need a few more definitions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if f is a function of the measurable set e to the reals including &plusmn &infin then we can write f = g h where g(x = f(x if f(x)>0 0 otherwise and h(x = -f(x if f(x < 0 0 otherwise
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: note that both g and h are non negative functions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: also note that |f| = g + h if ∫|f| is finite then f is called lebesgue integrable
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in this case both ∫g and ∫h are finite and it makes sense to define ∫f by ∫g ∫h
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it turns out that this definition is the correct one
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: complex valued functions can be similarly integrated by considering the real part and the imaginary part separately
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: every reasonable notion of integral needs to be linear and monotone and the lebesgue integral is if f and g are integrable functions and a and b are real numbers then af + bg is integrable and ∫(af + bg = a∫f + b∫g if f &le g then ∫f &le ∫g
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: two functions which only differ on a set of μ-measure zero have the same integral or more precisely if μ({x : f(x &ne g(x)} = 0 then f is integrable if and only if g is and in this case &int f = &int g one of the most important advantages that the lebesgue integral carries over the riemann integral is the ease with which we can perform limit processes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: three theorems are key here
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the monotone convergence theorem states that if f k is a sequence of non negative measurable functions such that f k x &le f k+1 x for all k and if f = lim f k then ∫f k converges to ∫f as k goes to infinity
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: note ∫f may be infinite here fatou's lemma states that if f k is a sequence of non negative measurable functions and if f = liminf f k then ∫f &le liminf ∫f k
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: again ∫f may be infinite the dominated convergence theorem states that if f k is a sequence of measurable functions with pointwise limit f and if there is an integrable function g such that |f k | &le g for all k then f is integrable and ∫f k converges to ∫f
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if f is non negative then ∫f d&mu is precisely the area under the curve as measured by the product measure &mu &times &lambda where &lambda is the lebesgue measure for r one can also circumvent measure theory entirely
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the riemann integral exists for any continuous function f of compact support
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: then we use functional analysis to obtain the integral for more general functions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: let c c be the space of all real-valued compactly supported continuous functions of r define a norm on c c by :||f|| = &int |f(x)| then c c is a normed vector space and in particular it is a metric space all metric spaces have completions so let l 1 be its completion
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this space is isomorphic to the space of lebesgue integrable functions modulo sets of measure zero
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furthermore the riemann integral &int defines a continuous functional on c c which is dense in l 1 hence &int has a unique extension to all of l 1
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this integral is precisely the lebesgue integral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in this formulation the limit taking theorems are hard to prove
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however in more general cases such as when the functions or perhaps the measures take values in a large vector space instead of r n ) this approach is a fast way of obtaining an integral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: here we discuss the limitations of the riemann integral and the greater scope offered by the lebesgue integral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: we presume a working understanding of the riemann integral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: with the advent of fourier series there arose the need to exchange summation and integral signs much more often
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however the conditions under which &sum k ∫f k and ∫&sum k f k are equal proved quite elusive in the riemann framework
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it may come as a surprise to the casual reader that these two quantities may not be equal so an example helps there are some other technical difficulties with the riemann integral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these are linked with the limit taking difficulty discussed above
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the solution as it turns out is to study an even simpler problem first
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the observation is that if we have a notion of length we can turn it into a notion of area
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: instead of measuring the area of a surface in the plane we turn our attention to measuring the length of subsets of the real line
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one obvious requirement is that an interval [a b] should have a length of b a
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: what other demands we should put on the notion of length is less clear and much effort was put into obtaining a useful definition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in fact the term length was first used but its construction was misguided and a later more useful construction is in use today it is called the measure
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: measure theory enables us to calculate the lengths of subsets of the real line
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it also fully classifies which sets have a length and which sets do not have a reasonable notion of length
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by spending the extra effort into calculating lengths carefully we now have a more solid foundation to work with
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: of course the riemann integral uses the notion of length anonymously
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: indeed the element of calculation for the riemann integral is the rectangle [a b] &times [c d] whose area is calculated to be b-a)(c-d
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: obviously the numbers b a and c d are meant to be the lengths of [a b] and [c d]
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however we can now augment the riemann integral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: indeed riemann could only use rectangles because he could only measure intervals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: equipped with a measure &mu we can calculate the length of sets much more interesting than intervals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: so if x and y are μ-measurable we can easily define the area of the cartesian product x &times y to be μ(x μ(y
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this definition clearly generalizes riemann's notion of area of a rectangle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the context of lebesgue integration sets such as x &times y are sometimes called rectangles even though they are far more complicated than the quadrilaterals of the same name
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: with the ability to measure the area of more complex rectangles we can attempt to integrate more complex functions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one crucial but nonobvious step was to drop the notion of upper sum
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while upper sums work just fine for bounded functions of bounded intervals there is a clear problem for unbounded functions or functions which are supported by all of the real line
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for instance the function f(x = 1/x 2 for x &gt 1 would necessarily have an infinite upper sum however it can be shown that this function has a finite integral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dropping the upper sum robs us of our main way of checking for integrability of functions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it isn't obvious how to decide on the integrability of functions while maintaining a consistent theory
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is very fortunate that a simple if technical definition is available
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the resulting theory of integration is much more accurate in describing limit taking processes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many of the original questions posed by fourier series about swapping the integral and summation signs are answerable using one or another of the various lebesgue integral limit theorems the main ones are monotone convergence dominated convergence and fatou's lemma see above
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mun ditindes awak tumbila bakal ngaluarkeun bau feromon nu matak sebel nu oge bisa kaambeu dina hawa nu teu kakekeb
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: though bedbug bites can occur singly they often follow a distinctive pattern of a linear group of three bites sometimes macabrely referred to as breakfast lunch and dinner
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these patterns of bites are caused when a bedbug is disturbed in feeding by a person moving and then the bedbug resumes feeding
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the effect of these bites on humans varies from person to person but often cause welts and swelling that are more itchy and longer lasting than mosquito bites
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some people however have little or no reaction to bedbug bites
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: those whose bodies do not initially react may subsequently develop symptoms however due to an allergic reaction caused by the development of antigen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a technique for catching detecting bedbugs is to have a light source accessible from bed and to turn it on at about an hour before dawn which is usually the time when bedbugs are most active
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a flashlight is recommended instead of room lights as the act of getting out of bed will cause any bedbugs present to scatter
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bedbugs can also sometimes be viewed during the day
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some individuals have used glue traps placed in strategic areas around their domicile sometimes used in conjunction with heating pads or balloons filled with exhaled breath thus offering the carbon dioxide that bedbugs look for in order to attract and thus detect bedbug infestations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are also commercial traps like flea traps whose effectiveness is really questionable except perhaps as a means of detection but traps will certainly not work to control an infestation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: veterinarians may mistake bedbugs leavings on a pet's fur as flea dirt
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the above having been said bedbugs are known for being elusive transient and nocturnal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for many the only way to detect and identify with certainty an infestation is to contact a pest control professional
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: with the widespread use of ddt in the 1940s and 50s bedbugs all but disappeared from north america in the mid twentieth century
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: infestations remained common in many other parts of the world however and in recent years have begun to rebound in north america
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: reappearance of bedbugs in the developed world has presented new challenges for pest control and without ddt and similarly banned agents no fully effective treatment is now in use
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the industry is only beginning to develop procedures and techniques
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: another reason for their increase is that pest control services more often nowadays use low toxicity gel based pesticides for control of cockroaches the most common pest in structures instead of residual sprays
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when residual sprays meant to kill other insects were commonly being used they resulted in a collateral insecticidal effect on potential bedbug infestations the gel based insecticides primarily used nowadays do not have any effect on bedbugs as they are incapable of feeding on these baits
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the professional pest management association a us advocacy group for pest control operators pcos conducted a proactive bed bug public relations campaign in 2005 and 2006 resulting in increased media coverage of bedbug stories and an increase in business for pcos possibly distorting the scale of the increase in bedbug infestations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if it is necessary to live with bedbugs in the short term it is possible to create makeshift temporary barriers around a bed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: because bedbugs cannot fly or jump an elevated bed can be protected by applying double sided sticky tape carpet tape or petroleum jelly around each leg or by keeping each leg on a plastic furniture block in a tray of water
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a bed frame can be effectively ridded of adult bedbugs and eggs by use of steam
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: small steam cleaners are available and are very effective for this local treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a suspect mattress can be protected by wrapping it in a painter's disposable plastic dropcloth neatly sealing shut all the seams with packing tape and putting it on a protected bed after a final visual inspection
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bedding can be sanitized by a 120° f 49° c laundry dryer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: once sanitized bedding should not be allowed to drape to the floor
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an effective way to quarantine a protected bed is to store sanitized sleeping clothes in the bed during the day and bathing before entering the bed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: vermin and pets may complicate a barrier strategy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bedbugs prefer human hosts but will resort to other warm blooded hosts if humans are not available and some species can live up to eighteen months without feeding at all
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a co infestation of mice can provide an auxiliary food source to keep bedbugs established for longer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: likewise a house cat or human guest might easily defeat a barrier by sitting on a protected bed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: such considerations should be part of any barrier strategy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some individuals have had success conducting their own exterminations by preparing an insecticide mixture of pyrethrins and fresh water diatomaceous earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at least one manufacturer produces a household insecticide d 20 with only .2% naturally derived pyrethrins and 1.0% piperonyl butoxide which magnifies the pyrethrins effectivenes by 10 times
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: natural pyrethrins are more expensive than many alternatives
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the function of the pyrethrins is to stimulate the nervous system of the bugs so that the spasms will allow the diatomaceous earth to dessicate puncture and kill the bugs through mechanical action
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: great care should be taken not to use products with salt water diatomaceous earth or heat treated diatomaceous earth which can damage the lungs of any mammal dogs cats or humans which inhale it and has also been known to cause cancer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: fresh water diatomaceous earth however is commonly used to deworm cats dogs and humans and is considered as safe as table salt
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: others have used fruit and vegetable insecticides comprised of a mixture of pyrethins and canola oil which are usually safe for humans and most pets aside from fish
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: contrary to popularly disseminated information extreme heat or extreme cold is usually not effective in eliminating bedbugs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pest control professionals receive reports of infestations even in the dead of winter and manufactured environments of extreme heat or cold such as encasing a mattress in a bag and placing it in direct sunlight or placing a suspect piece of bedding or clothing in a freezer usually cannot stay consistently hot or cold enough to sufficiently kill bedbugs which are not particularly sensitive to temperature extremes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in addition since bedbugs normally disperse treatment of a bed or mattress is insufficient to eradicate an infestation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: due to their absence from north america for several decades not all exterminators in that region are familiar with extermination techniques for bedbugs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the past fumigation with cyanogas was used for bedbug control
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this was very effective but also very dangerous
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this method is no longer used
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: fumigation that is the use of poison gases is costly and though this has been tried as a method of control in isolated cases it is transient
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: new infestation can be imported shortly after a fumigation has taken place
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: fumigation does work but it may not be practical and may not be permitted in most jurisidictions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: care must thus be taken when selecting an exterminator in order to select a professional that knows how to conduct proper bedbug removal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the national pest management association can assist in the location of pest control professionals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an informal survey of pest control professionals conducted by a pest control professor at the university of massachusetts stated that 68% of all bedbug infestations require three or more treatments 26% require two treatments and 6% require just one
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however this survey does not seem to have taken into account the size of the infestation the size of the venue being treated the extensiveness of that venue's preparation for the treatment thus enabling or inhibiting coverage of the poisons the skill of the exterminator whether popular nesting places have been disposed of and the cause behind the original infestation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most reputable pest control professionals require that the domicile be prepared by residents prior to their arrival for a chemical treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if an apartment is not properly prepared either by the resident or the professional the coverage of pesticides and or chemical treatment throughout the domicile will be impaired and thus the effectiveness of the treatment will be heavily reduced
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: all furniture and appliances in the dwelling usually need to be pulled away from the baseboards and it is commonly asked that all furniture containing potential hiding crevices such as bookshelves and desks be emptied and left open for the exterminator to spray
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: items in tightly sealed containers are usually safe from bedbug infestation and need not be emptied
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: everything possible should be laundered such as clothing rugs and stuffed toys
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for maximum effect laundry should be handled in a coordinated attack shortly before or after a pesticide treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the entire household's laundry should be securly tied into plastic bags all at one time and brought back into the home only after the living space has been treated
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dry cleaners should be informed of an infestation and items should be properly bagged when delivered to a dry cleaning service
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: laundered objects should be encased in securely tied garbage bags until they reach the laundry machine and the bags should be discarded
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: whenever practical hot water and a 120° f 49° c drying session extended by a few extra minutes are preferred
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as extensive laundering of clean clothes may pose an excessive cost for some drying clothing alone is completely effective in killing all stages
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: laundering the clothes is then an aesthetic that makes some people feel better but it is not necessary if the drying is done at medium to high heat for at least 20 minutes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: allow for time for the dryer to heat the clothes as the 20 minute to kill all stages is at the medium to high heat as noted above
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mechanical removal of bedbugs by vacuuming is a most important part of preparing for control
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: vacuuming alone will not solve the problem but it can substantially reduce bedbugs numbers and thus help reduce the population as part of preparing for treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a crevice attachment should be used on the seams of mattresses on box springs on bed legs on mattresses box springs within furniture interiors behind pictures on curtains and anywhere there is a possibility of the insects hiding e.g inside dresser drawers dresser cases under chairs etc
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: carpets should also be vacuumed throughout the home preferably with a power head
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: baseboards should also be vacuumed using the crevice tool &mdash not swept &mdash prior to the exterminator's arrival and the filter should be immediately removed and discarded outdoors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some pest control firms do offer steam treatment for items like mattresses or upholstered furniture especially when individuals are concerned about pesticides on bedding
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this has only a very limited effectiveness however it is quite effective in this range of less than 1/2 inch of penetration
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this also depends on the time that the steam is applied to the surface of the item
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: small steam cleaners for domestic use can be useful for mattresses and the surfaces of upholstered furniture
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is a worthwhile option if there are issues of allergy and the homeowner takes the time to treat carefully in this limited context
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are differing opinions as to whether it is necessary to dispose of mattress boxsprings futons pillows and other bedding
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is of course often a heavy cost involved in the complete replacement of such bedding
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a decision as to whether to replace bedding or not can depend on the condition of and often related level of infestation within the items the comfort level of the owner whether the owner can afford replacement and aesthetics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: treatment of these items must be done with care and according to the label
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mattresses typically need local treatment with non residual insecticides at seams and borders
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: boxsprings are more difficult to treat as there are more places for the insects to hide
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after the mattress and or box spring or futon has been treated placing these inside a cotton or a polyvinyl or polyethylene bag is a good idea as a secondary means of defense
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bedbugs like to hide near the victim and are commonly found on seams of mattreses or within the structure of box springs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mattress bag serves to reduce this likelihood and in the case of box springs it seals any remaining insects inside the bag
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mattress bag also protects the mattress from the mess of staining caused when bedbugs aggregate on seams
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the bag is a good idea either until the infestation has been totally eliminated or in the case of good quality cotton bags useful as a permanent protection for the mattress and also to enable easier control if infestation recurs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: those who end up disposing of suspect items should enclose them in plastic mattress bags or large garbage bags to prevent shedding bugs and eggs on their way to the disposal site
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: care should also be taken to label throwaway items with a warning about the suspected bedbug infestation as furniture is often reclaimed by dumpster divers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: new items should not be purchased until after the infestation has been thoroughly eliminated
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: also many retailers offer disposal of old mattresses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this can pose obvious problems if new and old mattresses are carried together on the same truck without the proper precautions taken
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: exterminators will often apply a contact kill spray directly on bedbugs found in the apartment such as a mixture of cyfluthrin pyrethrins and piperonyl butoxide and then spray lambda cyhalothrin on baseboards and other favorite hiding places
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: lambda cyhalothrin acts as a slow kill barrier which kills bedbugs after they cross it and is usually microencapsulated making it safe to pets and humans after it dries
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: often deltamethrin is also injected into larger crevices
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the lambda cyhalothrin and the deltamethrin are at their strongest for the first two weeks following their application but usually retain effectiveness for up to 60 days
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: gentrol and phantom can also be used for bed bug control
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: gentrol contains the active ingredient s)-hydroprene an insect growth regulator igr that disrupts the normal growth development of cockroaches and stored product pests drain flies and fruit flies as well as bed bugs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: phantom® uses an active ingredient known as chlorfenapyr
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is non repellent and relatively long lasting
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: successful treatment of a bedbug infestation is often highly dependent on how thorough the pest control professional is
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although the assessment and judgment of the pest control professional should be respected most treatments cover such areas within domiciles as closets curtains outside and inside furniture crevices dresser and desk drawers night tables etc as well as the interior of electrical outlets and behind pictures hangings on walls
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the choice was made to retain bedding professionals will often either treat or steam clean bedframes and the undersurface of solid beds
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some higher end pest control firms also offer to perform the aforementioned vacuuming
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bedbugs can often be seen alive for up to two weeks following treatment of a dwelling although they should not be seen in great number e.g only one or two
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is important to continue to monitor for bedbugs after the initial treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: vacuuming should not be performed for a period of time following treatment as some pesticides dry as a fine film and can be prematurely removed from the environment if vacuumed allowing infestations to survive the treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: anecdotal evidence within the blogging community seems to suggest that many and perhaps most people who successfully deal with bedbug infestations find themselves overly paranoid about the possibility of reinfestation for varying lengths of time
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these feelings of anxiety may have some relation to delusory parasitosis sometimes an initial and real insect infestation precedes and triggers the delusion [...] out of desperation the victims may move out of their home only to report later that the bugs have followed them there too the physician's guide to arthropods of medical importance ja goddard crc press 1993.)-->
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: salain ti keur kaperluan resmi kunrei shiki teu ilahar ditarima di jero atawa luar jepang
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pamarentah ilaharna make hepburn keur romanisasi ngaran jepang jeung watesan di konteks basa inggris saperti sababaraha basa husus dina paspor jeung rambu jalan
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: loba nagara kaasup nagara di anglosphere neruskeun make hepburn
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sabab kunrei shiki dumasar kana fonologi basa jepang pamake basa inggris kadang kala hese narima utamana keur sababaraha kombinasi kana anyar saperti ティーム(チーム team

lines.value: apostrophe nandakeun teu stabil tapi dianggap sarua sora
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sanajan kitu gi ga haritna gambar lucu utamana tyo-jyu-jinbutu-gi-ga 鳥獣人物戯画 sacara literatur gambar lucu keur sato jeung jalma ) digambar dina abad ka 12 ku sababaraha pelukis nembongkeun kualitas tur caria manga nu sederhana dina garis garis artistik
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga developed from a mixture of ukiyo e and foreign art movements
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when the united states began trading with japan japan tried to modernise itself and catch up with the rest of the world
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: thus they imported foreign artists to teach their students things such as line form and colour things which were never concentrated on in ukiyo e as the idea behind the picture was normally considered more important
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga at this period was known as ponchi e punch-picture and like its british counterpart punch magazine mainly depicted humour and political satire in short 1 or 4 picture format
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga as people know it in the 20th and 21st centuries only really came into being after dr osamu tezuka widely acknowledged to be the father of story based manga became popular
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1945 tezuka who was studying medicine saw a war propaganda animation film called momotarou uminokaihei whose style was largely influenced by disney's fantasia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: though a war propaganda film it was also a children's film so the main theme of the film was peace and hope in the time of darkness
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tezuka was greatly inspired by the film and later decided to become a comic artist which at the time and somewhat even now was an unthinkable choice for a qualified medical doctor
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he later commented that a part of reason he went to medical school was to avoid conscription and he actually did not like seeing blood
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tezuka introduced film like story telling and character in comic format in which each short film like episode is part of larger story arc the only text in tezuka's comics was the characters dialogue and this lent the comics a cinematic quality
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tezuka also adopted disney like facial features where a character's eyes mouth eyebrows and nose are drawn in a very exaggerated manner to add more distinct characterisation with fewer lines which made his prolific output possible
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this somewhat revived the old ukiyo e like tradition where the picture is a projection of an idea rather than actual physical reality
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: initially his comic was published in a children's magazine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: soon it became a specialised weekly or monthly comic magazine which is now the foundation of the japanese comic industry
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tezuka adapted his comic to almost all film genres at the time
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: his manga series cover from action adventure for example kimba the white lion jungle emperor leo to serious drama black jack to science fiction astro boy horror for example dororo the three eyed one it is often commented that any manga genre which tezuka did not create was done by someone who was desperately trying to find something tezuka wasn't doing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: though he is known in the west as a creator of the children's animation astro boy many of his comics had some very mature and sometimes dark undertones
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most of his comics central characters had a tragic background
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: atom astro boy was created by a grieving scientist trying to create an imitation of his dead son and who later abandoned the boy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: kimba's father was killed by human hunters and the conflict between man and nature was a recurring theme for the comic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hyakkimaru in dororo was born severely crippled because his father offered 48 parts of dororo's infant body to 48 demons
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some criticise tezuka's somewhat excessive use of tragic dramatisation in his stories
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as the manga generation of children grew up the market for comics expanded accordingly and manga soon become a major cultural force of japan
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tezuka also contributed to the social acceptance of manga
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: his qualification as a medical doctor as well as the holder of ph.d in medical science as well as his serious storylines were used to deflect criticism that manga was vulgar and undesirable for children
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he also mentored a number of important comic artists such as fujiko fujio creator of doraemon fujio akatsuka and shotaro ishinomori
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: another important trend in manga was gekiga dramatic pictures
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: between the 1960s and the 1970s there were two forms of comic serialisation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one the manga format was based on the sales of anthology magazines which contained dozen of titles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the other gekiga was based on a rental format of an individual manga book of single title
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga was based on weekly or biweekly magazine publications so production was prompt and the deadline was paramount
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: consequently most manga artists adopted tezuka's style of drawing where characters are drawn in a simpler but exaggerated manner typified by the large round eyes regarded abroad as a defining feature of japanese comics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in contrast gekiga typically had more complex and mature story lines with higher production value per page
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for this reason gekiga was considered to be artistically much superior
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however gekiga's rental business model eventually died out in the 1970s while manga artists significantly improved their graphic quality
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: eventually gekiga was absorbed into manga and now is used to describe a manga style which does not use cartoonish drawing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the gekiga style manga most famous abroad is probably akira
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however gekiga did not only influence the art style of manga after the 70s more mature themed pictures and plotlines were used in manga
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many had significant depictions of violence and sex and were marketed at teenagers unlike in tezuka's time children in the 70s had more disposable income so they could directly purchase manga without asking their parents to buy it for them
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: thus manga publishers did not need to justify their products to the parents
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: moreover the dominance of the serialised manga format on a weekly basis meant that manga was increasingly becoming pulp fiction with large amounts of violent content and some nudity especially although not exclusively in manga aimed at boys
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: representative titles of this genre were harenchi gakuen by go nagai and makoto chan by kazuo umezu both of which had copious amounts of gore nudity and vulgar often scatological jokes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: much like in the united states teachers and parents loathed manga but unlike the us no attempt was made to create an oversight board like the comics code authority
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: interestingly manga magazines for children in the 70s arguably had more vulgar themes due to the fact that it was the only major publishing format available but by the 80s and 90s new magazines catering to teenagers and young adults had come into play
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: with an immense market in japan manga encompasses a very diverse range of subjects and themes satisfying many readers of different interests
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: popular manga aimed at mainstream readers frequently involves sci fi action fantasy and comedy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: notable manga series are based on corporate businessman the shima kousaku series chinese cuisine iron wok jan criminal thriller monster and military politics the silent service
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: though roughly equivalent to the american comic book manga holds more importance in japanese culture than comics do in american culture
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in economic terms weekly sales of comics in japan exceed the entire annual output of the american comic industry
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: several major manga magazines which contain about a dozen episodes from different authors sell several million copies each per week
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga is well respected both as an art form and as a form of popular literature though it has not reached acceptance of historically higher art genres like film or music
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however approval of hayao miyazaki's anime and some of other works of manga are gradually changing the perception of anime and manga placing them closer to the status of higher arts top of box office charts of all time in japan is spirited away by hayao miyzaki 30.4 billion yen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: like its american counterpart some manga has been criticized for being violent or sexual
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example a number of film adaptation of manga such as ichi the killer or old boy were rated restricted or mature in the states
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however there have been no official inquiries or laws trying to limit what can be drawn in manga except for vague decency laws applying to all published materials stating that overly indecent materials should not be sold this freedom has allowed artists to draw manga for every age group and for about every topic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are several expressive techniques staple and some of them unique to the manga art form expressive dialogue bubbles the borders of the speech thought bubbles changes in pattern style to reflect the tone and mood of the dialogue
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example an explosion shaped bubble for an angry exclamation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: also manga does not usually follow the normal western comic conventions for speech solid arc extending from the character's head and thought bubble several small circles used in place of the arc
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: speed lines often in action sequences the background will possess an overlay of neatly ruled lines to portray direction of movements
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: speed lines can also be applied to characters as a way to emphasis the motion of their bodies limbs in particular
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this style especially background blurs extends into most action based anime as well
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mini flashbacks many artists employ copies of segments from earlier chapters sometimes only a single panel and edit them into the story panels to act as a flashback also applying an overlay of darker tone to differentiate it from current events
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this can be considered a convenient method to evoke prior event(s along with visual imagery
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in situations where a character's life events flash across his her mind a splash page maybe used with the entire background consisting of segments from earlier chapters
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: abstract background effects these involve elaborate hatching patterns in the background and serve to indicate or strengthen the mood of the plot
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it can also illustrate a character's state of mind
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: symbols certain visual symbols have been developed over the years to become common methods of denoting emotions physical conditions and mood
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the following is a brief list of representative manga symbols and usage the popular and recognizable style of manga is very distinctive
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: emphasis is often placed on line over form and the storytelling and panel placement differs from those in american comics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: impressionistic backgrounds are very common as are sequences in which the panel shows details of the setting rather than the characters
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: panels and pages are typically read from right to left consistent with traditional japanese writing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while the art can be incredibly realistic or cartoonish it is often noted that the characters have large eyes female characters usually have larger eyes than male characters small noses tiny mouths and flat faces
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: large eyes have become a permanent fixture in manga and anime since the 1960s when osamu tezuka see above started drawing them in this way mimicking the style of disney cartoons from the united states
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: further more inside the big eyes the transparent feeling of pupils and the glares or small reflections in the corners of the eyes are often exaggerated regardless of surrounding lighting although they are only present in living characters the eyes of characters who have died are the colour of the iris but darker
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see also bishoujo being a very diverse artform however not all manga artists adhere to the conventions most popularized in the states through anime such as akira sailor moon dragon ball z and ranma ½
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a fair number of manga artists do not feel that their stories and characters are set in stone
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: so a set of characters may build relationships jobs etc in one set of stories story arc only to have another story arc run where the same characters do not know each other
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the tenchi series in particular is known for this there are more than thirteen different unrelated story arcs based around tenchi and his friends
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is also the case of jojo's bizarre adventure where the protagonist changes depending on the story arc following new generation of characters
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the following is a non exhaustive and incomplete list of artistic conventions used in mainstream manga and their place of origin
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga magazines usually have many series running concurrently with approximately 20–40 pages allocated to each series per issue
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these manga magazines or anthology magazines as they are also known colloquially phone books are usually printed on low quality newsprint and can be anywhere from 200 to more than 850 pages long
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga magazines also contain one shot comics and various four panel yonkoma equivalent to comic strips
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga series can run for many years if they are successful
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga artists sometimes start out with a few one shot manga projects just to try to get their name out
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if these are successful and receive good reviews they are continued
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when a series has been running for a while the stories are usually collected together and printed in dedicated book sized volumes called tankobon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these are the equivalent of american comic's trade paperbacks
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these volumes use higher quality paper and are useful to those who want to catch up with a series so they can follow it in the magazines or if they find the cost of the weeklies or monthlies to be prohibitive
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: recently deluxe versions have also been printed as readers have gotten older and the need for something special grew
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: old manga have also been reprinted using somewhat lesser quality paper and sold for 100 yen approximately one us dollar each to compete with the used book market
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga are primarily classified by the age and gender of the target audience
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in particular books and magazines sold to boys shonen and girls shojo have distinctive cover art and are placed on different shelves in most bookstores
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: japan also has manga cafes or manga kissaten
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at a manga kissaten people drink coffee and read manga
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many things appear in manga format including wanted posters for criminals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: traditionally manga are written from right to left
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some publishers of translated manga keep that format but some switch the direction to left to right so as not to confuse foreign readers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this pratice is known as flopping and is often criticized by the readers and even the artists themselves citing that it goes against their original intentions for example if a person wears a shirt that reads may on it and gets flopped then the word is altered to yam
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some manga artists will produce extra sometimes unrelated material which are known as omake lit bonus or extra
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they might also publish their unfinished drawings or sketches known as oekaki lit sketches
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dojinshi is produced by small amateur publishers outside of the mainstream commercial market in a similar fashion to small press independently published comic books in the united states
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: comiket the largest comic book convention in the world with over 400000 gathering in 3 days is devoted to dojinshi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unofficial fan made comics are also called dojinshi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some dojinshi continue with a series story or write an entirely new one using its characters much like fan fiction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many of these genres apply equally well to anime which very often includes adaptations of manga and japanese computer games some of which are also adaptations of manga
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: manga has long had an influence on international comics and animation the world over
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: american artist and writer frank miller has been heavily influenced by manga and in particular by kazuo koike's 28 volume samurai epic lone wolf and cub
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: miller was one of the first american comic artists to make use of decompression a style prevalent in manga
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other american artists such as becky cloonan demo east coast rising corey lewis sharknife peng and canadian bryan lee o'malley lost at sea scott pilgrim are heavily influenced by the mainstream manga style and have received acclaim for their work outside of anime manga fan circles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these artists have their roots in the anime manga subculture of their particular regions as well as the internet and webcomics but incorporate many other influences that make their work more palatable to non manga readers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: american artist paul pope worked in japan for kodansha on the manga anthology afternoon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: before he was fired due to an editorial change at kodansha he was developing many ideas for the anthology that he would later publish in the us as heavy liquid
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as a result his work features a strong influence from manga without influences from international otaku culture
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in france there is a nouvelle manga movement started by frederic boilet which seeks to combine mature sophisticated daily life manga with the artistic style of traditional franco belgian comics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while the movement also involves japanese artists a handful of french cartoonists other than boilet have decided to embrace its ideal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in addition there are many amateur artists who are influenced exclusively by the manga style
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many of these have their own small publishing houses and some webcomics in this style have become very popular see megatokyo
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for the most part these artists are not yet recognized outside of the anime and manga fan community
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many people outside of those circles view those works as being too focused on the american anime subculture and not focused enough on telling stories that resonate with a wider audience
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the manga style has influenced not only writers and artists but musicians as well
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: turkish rock band manga has not only its name derived from the style their videos and album cover feature manga style animation and the members of the band have their own manga characters drawn by award winning artist kaan demircelik
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: standardized moment kaopat dihartikeun salaku &mu 4 &sigma 4 nu mana &mu 4 mangrupa momen mean kaopat jeung &sigma nyaeta simpangan baku

lines.value: <!in the lungs gaseous exchange takes places and the blood releases carbon dioxide into the lung cavity and picks up oxygen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the oxygenated blood then flows through pulmonary veins to the left atrium
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: from the left atrium this newly oxygenated blood passes through the mitral valve to enter the left ventricle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the left ventricle then pumps the blood through the aorta to the entire body
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: even the lungs take some of the blood supply from the aorta via bronchial arteries
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the left ventricle is much more muscular 1.3 1.5 cm thick than the right 0.3 0.5 cm thick as it has to pump blood around the entire body which involves exerting a considerable force to overcome the vascular pressure
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as the right ventricle needs to pump blood only to the lungs it requires less muscle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: even though the ventricles lie below the atria the two vessels through which the blood exits the heart the pulmonary artery and the aorta leave the heart at its top side
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the contractile nature of the heart is due to the presence of cardiac muscle in its wall which can work continuously without fatigue
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the heart wall is made of three distinct layers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first is the outer epicardium which is composed of a layer of flattened epithelial cells and connective tissue
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: beneath this is a much thicker myocardium made up of cardiac muscle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the endocardium is a further layer of flattened epithelial cells and connective tissue which lines the chambers of the heart
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the blood supply to the heart itself is supplied by the left and right coronary arteries which branch off from the aorta
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see main page cardiac cycle the function of the heart is to pump blood around the body
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: every single beat of the heart involves a sequence of events known as the cardiac cycle which consists of three major stages atrial systole ventricular systole and complete cardiac diastole
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the atrial systole consists of the contraction of the atria and the corresponding influx of blood into the ventricles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: once the blood has fully left the atria the atrioventricular valves which are situated between the atria and ventricular chambers close
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this prevents any backflow into the atria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is the closing of the valves that produces the familiar beating sounds of the heart commonly referred to as the lub dub sound
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the ventricular systole consists of the contraction of the ventricles and flow of blood into the circulatory system
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: again once all the blood empties from the ventricles the pulmonary and aortic semilunar valves close
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: finally complete cardiac diastole involves relaxation of the atria and ventricles in preparation for refilling with circulating blood
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: cardiac muscle is self exciting
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is in contrast with skeletal muscle which requires either conscious or reflex nervous stimuli
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the heart's rhythmic contractions occur spontaneously although the frequency or heart rate can be changed by nervous or hormonal influences such as exercise or the perception of danger
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the rhythmic sequence of contractions is coordinated by the sinoatrial and atrioventricular nodes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the sinoatrial node often known as the cardiac pacemaker is located in the upper wall of the right atrium and is responsible for the wave of electrical stimulation see action potential that initiates atria contraction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: once the wave reaches the atrioventricular node situated in the lower right atrium it is conducted through the bundles of his and causes contraction of the ventricles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the time taken for the wave to reach this node from the sinoatrial nerve creates a delay between contraction of the two chambers and ensures that each contraction is coordinated simultaneously throughout all of the heart
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the event of severe pathology the purkinje fibers can also act as a pacemaker this is usually not the case because their rate of spontaneous firing is considerably lower than that of the other pacemakers and hence is overridden
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the heart also secretes anf atrial natriuretic factor a powerful peptide hormone that affects the blood vessels the adrenal glands the kidneys and the regulatory regions of the brain to regulate blood pressure and volume
lines.name: Sundanese
